sensors.name: Pulse oximeter SpO2
sensors.desc:
A standard ASA monitor that measures oxygenation
95% or higher. If the SpO2 level drops to 94% or below, the patient should be assessed immediately to identify and treat the cause. An SpO2 level of 90% or less is a clinical emergency and should be treated urgently.

sensors.name: Electrocardiogram (ECG)
sensors.desc:
A standard ASA monitor that measures the heart's electrical activity.
Heart rate: 60-100 beats per minute 
P wave: 80 milliseconds
PR interval: 120–200 milliseconds
RR interval: 0.6–1.2 seconds

sensors.name: Noninvasive blood pressure (NIBP) device
sensors.desc:
A standard ASA monitor that measures blood pressure.
Primary care: Systolic BP less than 160 mmHg and diastolic BP less than 100 mmHg
Secondary care: Systolic BP less than 180 mmHg and diastolic BP less than 110 mmHg

sensors.name: Temperature monitor
sensors.desc: A standard ASA monitor that measures body temperature normal interthreshold range of 36.7-37.1°C (99.9-98.8°F)

sensors.name: End-tidal carbon dioxide monitor
sensors.desc: Measures carbon dioxide levels. The normal range for carbon dioxide (CO2) monitoring in anesthesiology is 35-45 millimeters of mercury (mmHg) or 5–6% CO2.

sensors.name: Airway pressure monitor
sensors.desc:
Measures airway pressure.
Condition:
Typical mean airway pressure (cmH2O)
Normal lungs: 5-10
Airflow obstruction: 10-20
ARDS: 15-30

sensors.name: Intrauterine Pressure Catheter (IUPC)
sensors.desc:
Resting tone: Resting tone should be no more than 25 mm Hg.
Contraction intensity: The normal range for contraction intensity is 25-75 mm Hg.
Peak IUP: The normal value for peak IUP is 40-80 mm Hg.
